messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Re: Scouts/ Kathryn
messages.msgSnippet: My kids just started brownies and scouts. They needed to find some friends in the area so we decided to give it a go. I didn t expect that it would be for us
messages.messageBody:
My kids just started brownies and scouts. They needed to find some friends in the area so we decided to give it a go. I didn't expect that it would be for us but we love it so far. Two reasons that we were avoiding the cult :~) was that we believed it was too Christian for us and that I'd heard somewhere that it was not gay friendly. Generally, I'm not keen on religion as I find it divisive in nature and so not spiritual in the way I understand spirituality. On the other hand the group promotes all of the qualities that make a society inclusive and supportive. Daisy is an elf and elves think of others before themselves :~), the sentiment is wonderful. Anyway, I don't know about the gay issue and the boy scouts. We do not want to be involved or support anything that's not gay friendly. What's your take on this issue, as I assume you and Beth are lesbians, and if not you would probably be able to answer my question anyway.

Thanks for your comments,
Leslie@...

"You never change things by fighting the existing reality. To change something, build a new model that makes the existing model obsolete."
Buckminster Fuller


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
